Job Title: Merchandising Coordinator

Location: Providence, RI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Sales

Description:
At Hasbro, our mission is to entertain and connect generations of fans through the wonder of storytelling and exhilaration of play. We’re looking for adventurous and curious people who want to explore, experiment, and innovate to come up with the best ideas. Our culture has inspired our diverse team of highly skilled, highly creative, and highly committed individuals for 100 years and we believe the best is yet to come.

At Hasbro, we’re changing the face of play and entertainment. We’re looking for people who want to explore, experiment, and innovate to come up with the best ideas. Our culture of community, passion, integrity, creativity, and inclusion has inspired our diverse team of highly skilled, highly creative, and highly committed individuals for 100 years, and we believe the best is yet to come.

In this role, you will be supporting the merchandising organization at Hasbro that drives exceptional execution across retail partners both online and in retail stores. This role reports into the Sr. Director of Omni-Channel Merchandising.

A Day in the Life of a Merchandising Coordinator

Work with finance to open, gain approval, process, and track purchase orders and vendor invoices for the department.Lead the project kick-off process inputting relevant information into Hasbro systems that link to vendor partners.Manage item set up documentation supporting in-store features and displays.Create merchandising guides to support feature and display execution.Maintain and manage the department-wide calendar, ensuring alignment with cross-functional teams and key stakeholders.Coordinate and maintain department wide folders in the shared drive, ensuring documents are organized, accurate and up to date with the latest information.Plan, manage and execute events in coordination with Trade Marketing.

What you'll bring:

Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant discipline (Business or Administration) with 3+ years' experience in managing administrative functions for a team.Experience in managing projects from inception through completion.Ability to work independently; a self-starter that has proven experience in taking charge and managing their deliverables. Excellent time management skills; experience in simultaneously managing projects while meeting deliverable deadlines.Assertive professional that has experience in solving problems.Strong verbal, written and presentation skills – please share examples.Intermediate to advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Teams, PowerPoint and Excel)

Hasbro’s world-class brands and talented people are our greatest assets. One of the ways we invest in you is through a competitive and contemporary benefits package. Your particular benefits package will depend on your position, location, local legal requirements, and years with the company. Here’s a look at what your benefits package may include: Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance, Half-day Fridays year-round, Paid Vacation Time and holidays, Generous 401(k) match, Paid Parental Leave, Team Hasbro Volunteer Program, Employee Giving and Matching Gifts Programs, Tuition Reimbursement, Toy Discounts and more!

Hasbro is committed to equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment. We are committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, or any other legally protected status.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
